channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Biden does post-debate damage control, and Simone Biles heads to her 3rd Olympics
item.description: President Biden spent the weekend doing a lot of damage control following Thursday’s shaky debate. Simone Biles to lead U.S. Olympic gymnastics team.
item.content:encoded:
President Biden spent the weekend doing a lot of damage control following Thursday’s shaky debate. Simone Biles to lead U.S. Olympic gymnastics team.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: The Far right wins the first round of France’s snap election
item.description: The National Rally holds a strong lead in France's first round of legislative elections, polling agencies projected -- bringing the party closer to being able to form a government in round two.
item.content:encoded: The National Rally holds a strong lead in France's first round of legislative elections, polling agencies projected -- bringing the party closer to being able to form a government in round two.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: 'I would tell Biden to hang in there,' former DNC Chairman Howard Dean says
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin talks to former Democratic National Committee chair Howard Dean about Democrats' response to President Biden's debate performance, and whether Biden should drop out of the race.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin talks to former Democratic National Committee chair Howard Dean about Democrats' response to President Biden's debate performance, and whether Biden should drop out of the race.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: CDC's Heat & Health tracker collects ER data across the country in near real time
item.description: As extreme heat grips the nation, doctors and researchers hoping to understand the heat's real-time risks are tuning into a relatively new tool from CDC: the Heat & Health tracker.
item.content:encoded: As extreme heat grips the nation, doctors and researchers hoping to understand the heat's real-time risks are tuning into a relatively new tool from CDC: the Heat & Health tracker.
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Borunda

item.title: ‘I’m going to be fighting harder,’ Biden tells donors after disastrous debate
item.description: President Biden spent the weekend after the debate doing damage control, trying to convince supporters he’s still up to the job.
item.content:encoded:
President Biden spent the weekend after the debate doing damage control, trying to convince supporters he’s still up to the job.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: U.K. Labour Party candidate, born in China, writes about women's private evolutions
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with author and U.K. Labour Party candidate Yuan Yang about what women face in her former home country of China.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with author and U.K. Labour Party candidate Yuan Yang about what women face in her former home country of China.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: 2 U.S. military members discuss why they resigned over the war in Gaza
item.description: The number of resignations among Biden administration officials and American military service members over U.S. policy in Gaza is small, but growing.
item.content:encoded: The number of resignations among Biden administration officials and American military service members over U.S. policy in Gaza is small, but growing.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: New U.S. citizens explain what it means to be American
item.description: As Fourth of July festivities roll out across the nation this week, the celebrations hold special meaning for newly minted citizens.
item.content:encoded: As Fourth of July festivities roll out across the nation this week, the celebrations hold special meaning for newly minted citizens.
item.dc:creator: Hosts

item.title: The gymnasts who will represent the U.S. at the Olympics have been chosen
item.description: The gymnastics team that will represent Team USA at next month's Summer Olympics in Paris is set. Nearly 40 gymnasts competed over the weekend in Minneapolis.
item.content:encoded: The gymnastics team that will represent Team USA at next month's Summer Olympics in Paris is set. Nearly 40 gymnasts competed over the weekend in Minneapolis.
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Hundreds of Florida arts groups scramble for funding after DeSantis vetoes grants
item.description: There is no more state funding for the arts in Florida after Governor Ron DeSantis cut 32 million from the state budget. Now arts organizations are scrambling to make ends meet.
item.content:encoded: There is no more state funding for the arts in Florida after Governor Ron DeSantis cut 32 million from the state budget. Now arts organizations are scrambling to make ends meet.
item.dc:creator: Wilkine Brutus
